intro: Isolona leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered isolona, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a compact cluster, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Isolona leucantha is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
